meanings.definition: Having the same number of parts or segments
meanings.sent1: The caterpillar had an isomerous body, with identical segments along its length.
meanings.sent2: The puzzle pieces were isomerous, each having the same number of edges.
meanings.sent3: The isomerous chocolate bar had perfectly equal sections, making it easy to share.
meanings.sent4: The isomerous building blocks fit together seamlessly, creating a harmonious structure.
meanings.sent5: The isomerous pattern on the butterfly's wings was mesmerizing in its symmetry.

meanings.definition: Having the same number of parts in each whorl of a flower
meanings.sent1: The daisy had isomerous petals, with the same count in each layer.
meanings.sent2: The sunflower displayed isomerous seeds in each spiral of its center.
meanings.sent3: The isomerous flower arrangement looked like a perfectly balanced bouquet.
meanings.sent4: The isomerous flower petals danced in the wind, creating a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent5: The isomerous floral design on the fabric was both elegant and uniform.
